unnormalised: Reports are flooding in from Max Hospital, Delhi, where Dr. Meena Sharma, a leading Obstetrician-Gynecologist, just performed a groundbreaking surgery on a 42-year-old patient, Mrs. Aisha Khan. Apparently, Aisha had been trying for a baby for 7 yrs. and had multiple failed IVF attempts at other clinics. Dr. Sharma's team utilized a novel technique involving minimally invasive surgery (MIS) combined with advanced reproductive technologies. Sources say the surgery, which took approximately 6 hrs, was a complete success.
normalised: Reports are flooding in from Max Hospital, Delhi, where Doctor Meena Sharma, a leading Obstetrician-Gynecologist, just performed a groundbreaking surgery on a forty two year old patient, Missus Aisha Khan. Apparently, Aisha had been trying for a baby for seven years and had multiple failed I-V-F attempts at other clinics. Doctor Sharma's team utilized a novel technique involving minimally invasive surgery (M-I-S) combined with advanced reproductive technologies. Sources say the surgery, which took approximately six hours, was a complete success.

unnormalised: The procedure, according to a hospital statement released earlier today, addressed multiple issues contributing to Mrs. Khan's infertility, including severe endometriosis and fibroids. Dr. Sharma said that “The patient’s condition was complex, but we were confident that this approach would offer the best chance of success." She added that the team meticulously planned the procedure, using 3D imaging to map out the precise locations of the abnormalities.
normalised: The procedure, according to a hospital statement released earlier today, addressed multiple issues contributing to Missus Khan's infertility, including severe endometriosis and fibroids. Doctor Sharma said that “The patient’s condition was complex, but we were confident that this approach would offer the best chance of success." She added that the team meticulously planned the procedure, using three D imaging to map out the precise locations of the abnormalities.

unnormalised: What’s more exciting? Mrs. Khan is now reportedly pregnant! The confirmation came just 2 weeks post-op. The news has sparked quite the buzz amongst her family in Lucknow. It's also created quite the buzz in the medical community. Specialists from AIIMS and other hospitals are already reaching out to Dr. Sharma to understand the specifics of the procedure. Seems like everyone wants to know the secret sauce!
normalised: What’s more exciting? Missus Khan is now reportedly pregnant! The confirmation came just two weeks post-op. The news has sparked quite the buzz amongst her family in Lucknow. It's also created quite the buzz in the medical community. Specialists from A-I-I-M-S and other hospitals are already reaching out to Doctor Sharma to understand the specifics of the procedure. Seems like everyone wants to know the secret sauce!

unnormalised: Endometriosis, as some may know, affects roughly 1 in 10 women of reproductive age. It can cause chronic pain and difficulty conceiving. Fibroids, non-cancerous growths in the uterus, also complicate pregnancy. These combined issues really threw a wrench in Aisha's journey to motherhood. This innovative surgery offers hope for other women facing similar challenges. Many have already started making their way to Delhi in hopes of seeing Dr. Sharma!
normalised: Endometriosis, as some may know, affects roughly one in ten women of reproductive age. It can cause chronic pain and difficulty conceiving. Fibroids, non-cancerous growths in the uterus, also complicate pregnancy. These combined issues really threw a wrench in Aisha's journey to motherhood. This innovative surgery offers hope for other women facing similar challenges. Many have already started making their way to Delhi in hopes of seeing Doctor Sharma!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma and her team used a combination of laparoscopic and hysteroscopic techniques. These allowed them to remove the endometrial tissue and fibroids with minimal damage to the surrounding healthy tissue. Post-surgery, Mrs. Khan underwent hormonal therapy to optimize her chances of a successful pregnancy. It seems like it worked like a charm!
normalised: Doctor Sharma and her team used a combination of laparoscopic and hysteroscopic techniques. These allowed them to remove the endometrial tissue and fibroids with minimal damage to the surrounding healthy tissue. Post-surgery, Missus Khan underwent hormonal therapy to optimize her chances of a successful pregnancy. It seems like it worked like a charm!

unnormalised: According to hospital sources, Dr. Sharma has been pioneering advanced gynecological procedures for over 15 yrs. She's apparently completed over 2,000 successful surgeries. This latest achievement only solidifies her reputation as one of the top obstetricians and gynecologists in India.
normalised: According to hospital sources, Doctor Sharma has been pioneering advanced gynecological procedures for over fifteen years. She's apparently completed over two thousand successful surgeries. This latest achievement only solidifies her reputation as one of the top obstetricians and gynecologists in India.

unnormalised: The hospital has scheduled a press conference for 28/07/2024, where Dr. Sharma will provide more details about the surgery and Mrs. Khan’s progress. Initial consultations with Dr. Sharma are priced at approx. Rs. 2500. Until then, it's all speculation and whispered congratulations from those in the know! We’ll keep you all updated.
